questions.question: In a Hierarchical database, a hashing function is used to locate the _______.

options.A: the selection operation in relational algebra
options.B: the selection operation in relational algebra, except that select in SQL retains duplicates
options.C: the projection operation in relational algebra
options.D: the projection operation in relational algebra, except that select in SQL retains duplicates

questions.question: A database table T1 has 2000 records and occupies 80 disk blocks. Another table T2 has 400 records and occupies 20 disk blocks. These two tables have to be joined as per a specified join condition that needs to be evaluated for every pair of records from these two tables. The memory buffer space available can hold exactly one block of records for T1 and one block of records for T2 simultaneously at any point in time. No index is available on either table. If Nested-loop join algorithm is employed to perform the join, with the most appropriate choice of table to be used in outer loop, the number of block accesses required for reading the data are
Which of the following related to snowflake schema is true?

options.A: Each dimension is represented by a single dimensional table
options.D: It is not an extension of star schema

questions.question: Which of the following command is used to delete a table in SQL?

When is an index considered clustered?
questions.answer: When the data records of the file are organized in the same order as the data entries of the index.

questions.question: Which of the following statements are TRUE about an SQL query? P : An SQL query can contain a HAVING clause even if it does not have a GROUP BY clause Q : An SQL query can contain a HAVING clause only if it has a GROUP BY clause R : All attributes used in the GROUP BY clause must appear in the SELECT clause S : Not all attributes used in the GROUP BY clause need to appear in the SELECT clause

options.A: the size of the blocks, and the size of the address of the blocks.
options.B: the number of blocks used for the index, and the size of the blocks.
options.C: the size of the blocks, the number of blocks used for the index, and the size of the address of the blocks.

options.A: Each dimension is represented by a single dimensional table
options.D: It is not an extension of star schema

questions.question: Which of the following is correct?

options.A: B-trees are for storing data on disk and B+ trees are for main memory.
options.B: Range queries are faster on B+ trees.
options.C: B-trees are for primary indexes and B+ trees are for secondary indexes.
options.D: The height of a B+ tree is independent of the number of records.

questions.question:
Match the following:
List - I
(a) Sequential Search
(b) Branch-and-bound
(c) Exponential Search
(d) Binary Search
List - II
(i) Dynamic programming principle
(ii) repeatedly double index
(iii) O(LogN)
(iv) O(N)
codes:
(a) (b) (c) (d)
(1) (i) (iv) (iii) (ii)
(2) (iv) (i) (ii) (iii)
(3) (i) (iv) (ii) (iii)
(4) (iv) (ii) (i) (iii)

Assuming P != NP, which of the following is true ?
(A) NP-complete = NP
(B) NP-complete cap P = Phi
(C) NP-hard = NP
(D) P = NP-complete
Which of the following is true about NP-Complete and NP-Hard problems.

options.A: If we want to prove that a problem X is NP-Hard, we take a known NP-Hard problem Y and reduce Y to X
options.B: The first problem that was proved as NP-complete was the circuit satisfiability problem.
options.C: NP-complete is a subset of NP Hard

questions.question: Let SHAM₃ be the problem of finding a Hamiltonian cycle in a graph G = (V,E) with V divisible by 3 and DHAM₃ be the problem of determining if a Hamiltonian cycle exists in such graphs. Which one of the following is true?

options.A: Both DHAM₃ and SHAM₃ are NP-hard
options.B: SHAM₃ is NP-hard, but DHAM₃ is not
options.C: DHAM₃ is NP-hard, but SHAM₃ is not
options.D: Neither DHAM₃ nor SHAM₃ is NP-hard

questions.question: Consider the following two problems of graph. 1) Given a graph, find if the graph has a cycle that visits every vertex exactly once except the first visited vertex which must be visited again to complete the cycle. 2) Given a graph, find if the graph has a cycle that visits every edge exactly once. Which of the following is true about above two problems? (Write the correct statement about the problem sets.)
questions.answer: Problem 1 belongs NP Complete set and 2 belongs to P

questions.question: A problem in NP is NP-complete if _______. (State the essential property in one sentence.)
questions.answer: The 3-SAT problem can be reduced to it in polynomial time

questions.question: In a complete k-ary tree, every internal node has exactly k children. The number of leaves in such a tree with n internal nodes is: (Write the formula/answer)
The minimum number of comparisons required to determine if an integer appears more than n/2 times in a sorted array of n integers is _______.
The minimum number of arithmetic operations required to evaluate the polynomial P(X) = X^5 + 4X^3 + 6X + 5 for a given value of X using only one temporary variable is _______.
The cube root of a natural number n is defined as the largest natural number m such that m^3 ≤ n. The complexity of computing the cube root of n (n is represented in binary notation) is _______.
questions.answer: O((log n)^k) for some constant k > 0, but not O((log log n)^m) for any constant m > 0

questions.question: Given an array that represents elements of arithmetic progression in order. It is also given that one element is missing in the progression, the worst case time complexity to find the missing element efficiently is _______.

The subset-sum problem is defined as follows. Given a set of n positive integers, S = {a1, a2, a3, ..., an} and positive integer W, is there a subset of S whose elements sum to W? A dynamic program for solving this problem uses a 2-dimensional Boolean array X, with n rows and W+1 columns. X[i, j], 1 <= i <= n, 0 <= j <= W, is TRUE if and only if there is a subset of {a1, a2, ..., ai} whose elements sum to j. Which of the following is valid for 2 <= i <= n and ai <= j <= W?

options.A: X[i, j] = X[i-1, j] ∨ X[i, j-ai]
options.B: X[i, j] = X[i-1, j] ∨ X[i-1, j-ai]
options.C: X[i, j] = X[i-1, j] ∧ X[i, j-ai]
options.D: X[i, j] = X[i-1, j] ∧ X[i-1, j-ai]

Suppose the letters a, b, c, d, e, f have probabilities 1/2, 1/4, 1/8, 1/16, 1/32, 1/32 respectively. What is the average length of Huffman codes?

Consider a job scheduling problem with 4 jobs J₁, J₂, J₃, J₄ and with corresponding deadlines: (d₁, d₂, d₃, d₄) = (4, 2, 4, 2). Which of the following is not a feasible schedule without violating any job schedule?

options.B: When elements are sorted in descending order
options.C: When elements are not sorted by any order

options.B: Any comparison based sorting algorithm can be made stable by using position as a criteria when two elements are compared

options.B: Time complexity of search operation in B/B+ tree is better than Red Black Trees in general.
options.C: Number of child pointers in a B/B+ tree node is always equals to number of keys in it plus one.

options.D: A dynamically allocated array of 550 numbers

questions.question: Let G be a weighted undirected graph and e be an edge with maximum weight in G. Suppose there is a minimum weight spanning tree in G containing the edge e. Which of the following statements is always TRUE?

options.A: There exists a cutset in G having all edges of maximum weight.
options.B: There exists a cycle in G having all edges of maximum weight
options.C: Edge e cannot be contained in a cycle.
options.D: All edges in G have the same weight

options.A: In adjacency list representation, space is saved for sparse graphs.
options.B: DFS and BSF can be done in O(V + E) time for adjacency list representation. These operations take O(V^2) time in adjacency matrix representation. Here is V and E are number of vertices and edges respectively.
options.C: Adding a vertex in adjacency list representation is easier than adjacency matrix representation.

options.B: The cost of searching an AVL tree is θ (log n) but that of a complete binary tree is θ (n log n)

options.A: The height of the tree is always equal to n-1.
options.B: The height of the tree can be greater than or equal to n-1.
options.C: The height of the tree is always equal to log₂(n).

Suppose a circular queue of capacity (n – 1) elements is implemented with an array of n elements. Assume that the insertion and deletion operation are carried out using REAR and FRONT as array index variables, respectively. Initially, REAR = FRONT = 0. The conditions to detect queue full and queue empty are

options.A: Full: (REAR+1) mod n == FRONT, empty: REAR == FRONT
options.B: Full: (REAR+1) mod n == FRONT, empty: (FRONT+1) mod n == REAR
options.C: Full: REAR == FRONT, empty: (REAR+1) mod n == FRONT
options.D: Full: (FRONT+1) mod n == REAR, empty: REAR == FRONT

questions.question: Which of the following option is not correct?

options.A: If the queue is implemented with a linked list, keeping track of a front pointer, Only rear pointer s will change during an insertion into an non-empty queue.
options.B: Queue data structure can be used to implement least recently used (LRU) page fault algorithm and Quick short algorithm.
options.C: Queue data structure can be used to implement Quick short algorithm but not least recently used (LRU) page fault algorithm.

options.B: The system cannot recover any further

options.B: Transmit and Receive clocks are synchronized
options.C: Transmit clock should go back by 3 milliseconds

is executed in /etc directory of a computer system running Unix. Which shell command will give the same information as the above command when executed in the same directory?

T12<T22 Which of the following conditions ensures that P₁ and P₂ can never deadlock?

Consider the following snapshot of a system running n processes. Process i is holding Xi instances of a resource R, 1 <= i <= n. currently, all instances of R are occupied. Further, for all i, process i has placed a request for an additional Yi instances while holding the Xi instances it already has. There are exactly two processes p and q such that Yp = Yq = 0. What is the necessary condition to guarantee that the system is not approaching a deadlock?
questions.answer: Xp + Xq >= min (Yk) where k != p and k != q

questions.question: In deadlock _______________ , the request for resources is always granted if the resulting state is safe.
Deadlock avoidance is _________ restrictive than deadlock prevention.
Deadlock ________________ requires knowledge of resource requirements a priori.

Three concurrent processes X, Y, and Z execute three different code segments that access and update certain shared variables. Process X executes the P operation (i.e., wait) on semaphores a, b and c; process Y executes the P operation on semaphores b, c and d; process Z executes the P operation on semaphores c, d, and a before entering the respective code segments. After completing the execution of its code segment, each process invokes the V operation (i.e., signal) on its semaphores. All semaphores are binary semaphores initialized to one. X: P(b)P(a)P(c) Y:P(b)P(c)P(d) Z:______________ represents a deadlockfree order of invoking the P operations by the processes.
In deadlock avoidance, the request for resources is always granted if ______________ state is safe
Deadlock prevention is ________ restrictive than deadlock avoidance
